headline.print_headline: BBC Director Quits in Furor Over Coverage
headline.main: BBC Director Quits in Furor Over Coverage of Sexual Abuse

docs.snippet: George Entwistle stepped down Saturday amid a deepening controversy over BBC news reports on prominent public figures accused of pedophilia....
docs.abstract: BBC director general George Entwistle resigns, bowing to wave of condemnation by critics after weeks of turmoil over broadcaster's coverage of spreading pedophile scandal; Entwistle's sudden departure is prompted by outrage over report that Newsnight, network's flagship current affairs program, wrongly implicated former Conservative Party politician in pedophile scandal.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and RAVI SOMAIYA

docs.lead_paragraph: George Entwistle stepped down Saturday amid a deepening controversy over BBC news reports on prominent public figures accused of pedophilia.

headline.print_headline: Neighborhood That Emergency Workers Call Home Is Still Reeling From Storm
headline.seo: Gerritsen Beach, Home to Emergency Workers, Is Still Reeling From the Storm
headline.main: Neighborhood That Emergency Workers Call Home Is Still Reeling From Storm

docs.snippet: More than a week after Hurricane Sandy, Gerritsen Beach in Brooklyn, a seaside enclave of police officers, firefighters and emergency medics, is worse off than all but a few city neighborhoods....
docs.abstract: Gerritsen Beach in Brooklyn, a seaside enclave of the families of police officers, firefighters and emergency medics, is worse off than all but a few city neighborhoods as recovery from Hurricane Sandy continues; only one block in the village of 1,700 homes has had power and heat restored.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than a week after Hurricane Sandy, Gerritsen Beach in Brooklyn, a seaside enclave of police officers, firefighters and emergency medics, is worse off than all but a few city neighborhoods.

headline.print_headline: How To Bridge The Hiring Gap
headline.seo: Bridging the Hiring Gap for College Graduates
headline.main: How to Bridge the Hiring Gap

docs.snippet: Many C.E.O.’s lament that recent college graduates lack specific, technical skills, but these employers should realize that a broad education has benefits, too....
docs.abstract: Robert W Goldfarb Preoccupations column observes that many CEO's lament that recent college graduates lack specific, technical skills, but adds that these employers should realize that a broad education has benefits, too.
docs.lead_paragraph: Many C.E.O.’s lament that recent college graduates lack specific, technical skills, but these employers should realize that a broad education has benefits, too.

headline.seo: Jim Weber of Brooks Sports, and the Path to Running Shoes

docs.snippet: After devoting much of his early life to hockey, the C.E.O. of Brooks Sports says he needed to pivot and put his energy into business....
docs.abstract: The Boss column features Brooks Sports chairman and chief executive officer Jim Weber discussing his career and management technique.
docs.lead_paragraph: After devoting much of his early life to hockey, the C.E.O. of Brooks Sports says he needed to pivot and put his energy into business.

headline.print_headline: The Minutes Were Prepaid, but the Grief Was Free
headline.seo: Cellphone Minutes Were Prepaid, but the Grief Was Free
headline.main: The Minutes Were Prepaid, but the Grief Was Free

docs.snippet: A customer turned to the Haggler after prepaying for cellphone minutes — without knowing that there was a 90-day deadline for using them....
docs.abstract: David Segal The Haggler column; customer of TracFone turns to the Haggler after prepaying for cellphone minutes--without knowing that there was a 90-day deadline for using them.

headline.print_headline: A New Senator, Known Nationally and Sometimes Feared
headline.seo: Elizabeth Warren, Known, and Maybe Feared, on National Stage
headline.main: A New Senator, Known Nationally and Sometimes Feared

docs.snippet: Elizabeth Warren, the newly elected Democratic senator from Massachusetts, will become a member of the very club that sought to block her from leading the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau....
docs.abstract: Elizabeth Warren, newly elected Democratic senator from Massachusetts, will become a member of the very club whose Republican members sought to block her from leading the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, which she created in 2010; she has sent mixed signals on how she will approach her job and interact with Republican senators that spurned her.
docs.lead_paragraph: Elizabeth Warren, the newly elected Democratic senator from Massachusetts, will become a member of the very club that sought to block her from leading the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

headline.seo: Fiscal Impasse Now Takes Center Stage for Investors

docs.snippet: As the fiscal impasse in Washington takes center stage, investors should brace for various possible outcomes — including the chance that the effects won’t be as dire as some people predict....
docs.abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column holds that as the fiscal impasse in Washington takes center stage, investors should brace for various possible outcomes--including the chance that the effects will not be as dire as some people predict; contends there is possibility that gridlock will eventually lead to major tax and spending reforms.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the fiscal impasse in Washington takes center stage, investors should brace for various possible outcomes — including the chance that the effects won’t be as dire as some people predict.

headline.print_headline: Standing on the Edge of an Opportunity
headline.seo: Budget Showdown Offers an Opportunity for Progress
headline.main: Budget Showdown Offers an Opportunity for Progress

docs.snippet: The threat of automatic spending cuts and tax increases on Jan. 1 could force a genuinely bipartisan solution to the country’s budget problems....
docs.abstract: Christina D Romer Economic View column contends the threat of automatic spending cuts and tax increases on Jan 1, 2013, could force a genuinely bipartisan solution to the country’s budget problems; offers thoughts about situation, and about how Pres Obama and Congress could make progress.
docs.lead_paragraph: The threat of automatic spending cuts and tax increases on Jan. 1 could force a genuinely bipartisan solution to the country’s budget problems.
